page.title: 16TOURISM
page.content: The 750 year old{Great Hall,}once part of Winchester Castle, is visited by about 68,000 people a year.It is hired out for concerts and exhibitions.The {Westgate,}one of two mediaeval city gates still standing, is now a museum. Its original function (apart from defence) was as a prison and exhibits include leg irons and prison beds. Other exhibits include weapons, armour and an old ceiling. The wall is crumbling destroying inscriptions made by prisoners. The{Royal Hampshire {Regimental Museum}contains militaria. It is visited by 6500 sight-seers and researchers a year, summer being the busiest. A large number of tourists, many of them from abroad, visit the city area in summer. The shops, streets and car parks get really crowded and many local people avoid going into town as much as possible.
